current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Expressing support for the designation of
		  May 1, 2013, as “Silver Star Service Banner Day”.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
supports the
			 designation of May 1, 2013, as

quote.#tail:
and calls upon the people of the United States to observe the day with
			 appropriate programs, ceremonies, and activities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has always honored the sacrifices made
			 by the wounded and ill members of the Armed Forces;

text.#text:
Whereas the Silver Star Families of America was formed to
			 help the American people remember the sacrifices made by the wounded and ill
			 members of the Armed Forces by designing and manufacturing Silver Star Service
			 Banners and Silver Star Flags for that purpose;

Whereas the sole mission of the Silver Star Families of
			 America is to evoke memories of the sacrifices of members and veterans of the
			 Armed Forces on behalf of the United States through the presence of a Silver
			 Star Service Banner in a window or a Silver Star Flag flying;

Whereas May 1, 2013, is an appropriate date to designate
			 as

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 121 ATS: Expressing support for the designation of May 1, 2013, as “Silver Star Service Banner Day”.
